sense.gloss: bustling, busy, crowded, lively, prosperous, thriving
lively (party, voices, etc.), loud, noisy, merry, cheerful
to be crowded with people, to be bustling with
to prosper, to flourish, to do thriving business
to enliven, to liven up, to cause a stir in (e.g. the newspapers), to hit (the front page, headlines, etc.)

k_ele.e: 枯れ木も山のにぎわい

r_ele.r: かれきもやまのにぎわい

sense.gloss: half a loaf is better than none, even a dead tree adds to the interest of a mountain
to prosper, to flourish, to do thriving business, to be crowded with people
to make lively, to enliven, to make exciting

sdata.j: この↑通↑↓とお↓りは↑賑↑↓にぎ↓やかだ。
↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑店↑↓みせ↓は↑町↑↓まち↓の↑賑↑↓にぎ↓やかな↑区域↑↓くいき↓にある。
sdata.e: His shop is in a busy section of town.

sdata.j: ↑政治↑↓せいじ↓↑学↑↓がく↓とは↑何↑↓なに↓か。「セイジ」から、↑人々↑↓ひとびと↓は、まず、ジャーナリズムを↑賑↑↓にぎ↓わす↑政治↑↓せいじ↓↑的↑↓てき↓↑事件↑↓じけん↓を↑連想↑↓れんそう↓するでしょう。
sdata.e: What is political science? From the "political," people will probably first associate it with the political incidents that enliven journalism.

sdata.j: ↑海水浴↑↓かいすいよく↓↑場↑↓じょう↓は↑海水浴↑↓かいすいよく↓↑客↑↓きゃく↓で↑賑↑↓にぎ↓わっていた。
sdata.e: The beach was crowded with tourists.

sdata.j: ↑台湾↑↓たいわん↓のナイトマーケットは、↑賑↑↓にぎ↓やかなものだ。
↑市場↑↓いちば↓は↑賑↑↓にぎ↓わっている。
